author: zerosnacks
content:
At the latest ACD call there was a brief discussion on a proposal to increase the contract size limit to `2**16`.

My preliminary research into the topic is turning into quite a rabbit hole with specifically two discussions that haven't been active for a long time.

https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/removing-or-increasing-the-contract-size-limit/3045 and https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-5027-unlimit-contract-code-size/9010

Considering the appetite for complexity in single contracts has increased (both for gas optimisation and architectural simplicity) since this was last discussed, evident in Uniswap V4 and Balancer V2, I think it makes sense to renew the discussion.

Is there currently an active proposal or thread where this is being discussed?

content: we need to see benchmarks that worst-case jumpdest analysis is not a concern for larger contract sizes - not much to discuss until then
